creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
Your example renders fine for me with the current
branches/svg11 batik code. I suggest you get the
lastest version and try that.

There is no newer version on standard downloads... ! than one on 2005
Should I use nightly builds ?

batik-src-06-06-07.zip  
http://people.apache.org/builds/xml-batik/batik-src-06-06-07.zip
creator: admin@talente.ro
deweese@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #9)
> There is no newer version on standard downloads... ! than one on 2005
> Should I use nightly builds ?

   Yes you should use a nightly build, or get the code right out
of SVN.

> batik-src-06-06-07.zip  
> http://people.apache.org/builds/xml-batik/batik-src-06-06-07.zip

I've downloaded one of the latest nightly buid found here: 

http://arc.mcc.id.au/batik-nightly/batik-nightly-2006-06-07.zip

It seem now that the result is darkened ? Anyway is much better that beeing 
lighter.
Please look at the files attached !

If the link from where I've taken the zip is not good please try to put on the 
batik page NIGHTLY BUILDS more evident or please send here the link.

I will reopen the bug as long as it seem to be still there :) ! I've created a
svg file with lot of images in it's body encoded into, and some svg circles
with fill opacity 0.75 the circles and images are each of them groups. Please
notice the PDF bellow. I was pelased and nicely surprised to see that
rasteriser did a gif transparency for the background, but I was unhappy because
the images are greyed out/made transparent with that transparency level of 0.75
and sometimes more than once....
